conclusion: A, B, C, and D are the starting points where the liquid is released.
The liquid starts at point A.
The liquid flows down and encounters the first baffle (yellow).
The yellow baffle directs the liquid towards the left side.
The liquid continues flowing down and encounters the second baffle (brown).
The brown baffle further directs the liquid towards the left side.
The liquid then flows into container E.
The liquid starts at point B.
The liquid flows down and encounters the first baffle (yellow).
The yellow baffle directs the liquid towards the left side.
The liquid continues flowing down and encounters the second baffle (brown).
The brown baffle further directs the liquid towards the left side.
The liquid then flows into container E.
The liquid starts at point C.
The liquid flows down and encounters the first baffle (yellow).
The yellow baffle directs the liquid towards the right side.
The liquid continues flowing down and encounters the second baffle (brown).
The brown baffle further directs the liquid towards the right side.
The liquid then flows into container F.
The liquid starts at point D.
The liquid flows down and encounters the first baffle (yellow).
The yellow baffle directs the liquid towards the right side.
The liquid continues flowing down and encounters the second baffle (brown).
The brown baffle further directs the liquid towards the right side.
The liquid then flows into container F.
Liquid from points A and B will flow into container E.
